definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: (inaccessibly) high (cf. Trgum [[שְׂגַב]] Pa. [from Heb.] exalt);—Qal Pf.
3 fs. [[שָֽׂגְבָה]] De 2:36, of city, c. [[מִן]], be (too) high for capture.
3 mpl. [[שָֽׂגְבוּ]] Job 5:11 of pers., be high in prosperity.
be high, walls Is 30:13, Pr 18:11; city Is 26:5; God’s knowledge Ps 139:6 (unattainable).
be exalted, of God Is 2:11, Is 2:17, Is 33:5; his name Is 12:4, Ps 148:13.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[יְשַׂגֵּב]] Is 9:10, Ps 107:41; sf. [[יְשַׂגֶּבְךָ]] Ps 20:2, etc.;—trans. c. acc.:
set (securely) on high, Ps 20:2, Ps 69:30, Ps 91:14; c, [[מִן]], of foe Ps 59:2, affliction Ps 107:41.
exalt, in effective hostility, c.[[עַל]], Is 9:10.

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[יְשֻׂגׇ֑ב]] Pr 29:25 be set (securely) on high.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[יַשְׂגִּיב]] Job 36:22 God acts exaltedly [[בְּכׂחוֹ]].
